availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: In pursuance to a Judgement of the Fayette Circuit Court rendered at its June term 1862 in the cases of Jas W Henderson & others as A & B H Hall & others I will at the court house door in Lexington on Monday July 14 1862/ it being county court will at public auction to the highest bidder the valuable property on Main street in the City of Lexington purchased by said Halls of L. C. Randall & Co As there are 2 houses a Main street it will be . The lots front a Main street feet & back to Short sheet continued and is bounded on one side by the property of & on the other side by the property of This property will be sold upon a credit of 6-12 & 18 months The purchasers to give bonds with good securty & having witness from date.
